quote: I thought I told you to cancel that    order.  Now what am I supposed to do    with five thousand wrappages of    Cardassian yamok sauce.  They were    the only ones who could stomach that    swill!
Hey, are you gonna play, or what?

You ordered it, you're going    to pay for it!  I'll take half of    your paycheck every week for the    next... six years!    (turns to face him     squarely)   And from now on, no more Cardassian    food in here!  Ever!
C'mon, Nog, it's your turn.
... five thousand wrappages... that's    a lot of yamok sauce...
Look, either take your turn, or I    win.
... it'd be a shame for it to go to    waste...
(tosses in cards;     disgusted)   That's it; game's over.
Jake, I'm getting that... tingle in    the lobes.  And when a lobe tingles,    it means only one thing:    "Opportunity."
What're you talking about?
I'm talking about gold-pressed    latinum... maybe four, or five bars...
I thought you were talking about    yamok sauce.
You've got a lot to learn about    opportunity.       Come on.
Where?

Station log.  Stardate xxxx.xx.     With the help of the Federation,    Bajor is about to commence its first    large-scale energy transfer: The    tapping of the molten core of its    fifth moon, Jeraddo.
Magma pressures remain constant...
Differential subsurface movement is    at zero-point-three percent.
Is that good?
They'd tell you if it weren't.
Why is that red light blinking?
We're in normal standby mode.
I take it, then, that we're not    expecting any surprises.
We don't like surprises any more    than you do.
Minister Toran, these people are    professionals.
Forgive my bureaucratic nitpicking,    Major, but we're counting on Jeraddo's    energy to heat a few hundred thousand    Bajoran homes this winter.
With that in mind, we're due to make    our next inspection...
Anyway, so there I was, sitting in    Quark's, when Morn just comes over    and invites me for dinner... Grid    square twelve-delta reads clear of    life forms...
Morn?  Are you serious?
Beginning scan of grid square fifteen    delta...
So what did you say?
I told him I was busy.
Good.
But you know those seven or eight    little wiry hairs sticking out of    his forehead?
What... ?
They make him look kind of cute.
That's odd... Sensors read a humanoid    presence in fifteen delta.  Could be    one of the project thermologists.
Not in fifteen delta.
See for yourself.
All the inhabitants should've been    evacuated by now.       I'd better beam down there and see    what's going on.
Ready to transport.
I won't be long.
The problem is, they don't like    uniforms.
Neither do I, but it comes with the    job.
Which is?
Do we talk, or do they attack?
You're halfway pretty.
Does that mean I can come in?
Problem is, I don't like uniforms,    either.  They scare me.       We've had our fill of uniformed    bullies.
I'm no Cardassian.  You know you're    supposed to be out of here by now.
All I know is this farm.  If you    want proof, girl, just take a look    at my crop.
I'd rather you didn't call me "girl."
... Our crop, I should say.  Mostly    the katterpod beans.  You won't find    better katterpods.
My father always said you get bigger    katterpods when you spray in some    chlorobicrobes.
Is that right.  That could be.       So your family's farmers, then.
No... but if I don't get on your    good side soon, my arm's going to    fall off.
Pretty eyes like yours deserve a    meal.  Come on in.
I'm afraid we don't have the time.     Obviously, you were overlooked in    the general evacuation; I've got to    get you out of here.
We'll talk about that over supper.
Excuse me, Sir... Are you the captain    of the Lissepian cargo ship?
That's right.
And you do a lot of trading with the    Cardassians?
Why not... one thing about    Cardassians; they pay their bills.
Yes, I've heard that... And I've    also heard they really love their    yamok sauce.
Look, if you're trying to buy some    yamok sauce from me, boy, you're    wasting your time.  I'm not carrying    any.
We're not buying... we're selling.
Five thousand wrappages of it.
Where would you two boys get all    that yamok sauce?
We have connections.
... five thousand, you say.
And they can be yours for... say...    five bars of gold-pressed latinum.
That's a lot of latinum.
That's a lot of yamok sauce.
Look, I'm not carrying any latinum.     But I'll tell you what I'll do: I'll    trade you something for it.
We were kind of counting on latinum...
Hold on.       What would you trade?
I'll give you a hundred gross of    self-sealing stem bolts.  Some Bajoran    ordered them from me, and now he    can't pay.
Self-sealing stem bolts?
Top grade merchandise; you won't    find a better stem bolt in this    sector.
I don't think so.  We deal strictly    in latinum.
Nog, are you sure?
What're we going to do with stem    bolts?
What're we going to do with yamok    sauce?
Sir, I've discussed it with my    partner, and you have a deal.
Good.  I'll meet you at cargo bay    nine at twenty-one hundred hours.     We'll make the trade then.
Now the question is, what do we do    with a hundred gross of self-sealing    stem bolts.
I've got a better question.  How do    we get your uncle's yamok sauce?
At least you're not the type that'd    dispossess a man on an empty stomach.
I wouldn't think of it.
That's fine.  Of course, these roots    take about three hours to soften.
What?
Surely you don't eat your roots hard.
I'm in no hurry.       Kira to Ganges.
This is Dax.  Are you all right?
A man with a talent for delay just    invited me to a farewell supper here.     You go on.  I'll have one of the    thermologists bring me back.
Enjoy supper; Dax out.
After you wash it, scrub off the    skin.
You don't talk much, do you?

They don't talk at all.  Cardassians    took care of that.  They escaped to    this moon about eighteen years ago.     I've been here forty.  We've done    well together.       Be a good girl, and set out the plates    and utensils, please.
In that cupboard on the other side    there.
Y'know, dear, you look good even    from this angle; but you walk like a    carnivorous rastipod.
(wheels around; losing     it)   Now look!...
You're trying to make me mad.
How'm I doing?
Not well enough to get rid of me.
Damn.
So what do they call you, dear?
I'm Major Kira; I'm in charge of    evacuating all the...
You're given name.
Nerys.
Well, Nerys, I'm Mullibok, and this    root really does take three hours to    cook, so... You sit yourself down    and relax, child, it'll be tasty.
Mullibok, they begin tapping the    core of this moon in seven days.
I know.
With respect... you are only three    people.  This project will benefit    thousands... hundreds of thousands.
I made myself unconcerned with all    of that forty years ago when I ran    away from a Cardassian labor camp on    your precious Bajor.
What we're trying to create now is    what you weren't allowed to have    then.  It can be your Bajor, too.
This is where I live.  This is my    home.
You'll have a home on Bajor... and    people who'll welcome you and your    friends.  Life'll be different, yes.     But it'll be fine... really.
No it won't.  I told you; my life is    here.  I'll die if I leave.       I'd rather die here.
Uncle Quark...
Last night... that dabo player who    dropped his drink... I saw you run    and get him another one without    charging him.  I've warned you about    picking up your father's habits.

It'll never happen again, Uncle.       Y'know, I was trying to find some    storage space for the shipment of    lokar beans that're due in tomorrow.     Is it okay if I stack them on top of    the yamok sauce?       If I can reach that high.
Please!  Don't talk to me about yamok    sauce.
Do you want me to get rid of it?  I    can take it to the matter reclamation    unit.
Anything... Just get it out of my    sight.       You're a good boy, Nog.

I stowed away on a Cardassian survey    vessel.  They made stops all through    the Bajoran system, looking for    possible mining sites.  When they    got here to Jeraddo, I overpowered    the crew and stole what I'd need to    start building my life here.
You overpowered the crew... by    yourself?

There were only six of them...       ... which was fortunate, because I'd    been weakened a bit by captivity and    starvation.       Anyway, here I was; the first person    ever to settle on this moon.  Trouble    was, I had no farm implements.  Once    again, starvation and I stared each    other in the face.       I'm not boring you... ?
No, no, I want to hear who won.
Well, it was mind over matter.  Every    twenty-six hours I just tightened my    waist-belt another notch, so my belly    could never really be sure it was    shrinking.
Excuse me... ?
Now you asked me how I got started    here, and I'm trying very politely    to tell you, if you'll kindly let me    finish.
I assume you found some food before    you ran out of belt notches.
Are you telling this story or am I?
By all means...
Well, it was obvious I was going to    have to plant and harvest a crop.     So I did what anyone'd do who had an    entire world to build...

... I rolled back and forth across    the ground til it surrendered.  Then    I went down on my hands and knees    and started to plow... Using my bare    fingernails, mind you... I plowed    every last furrow in that field    straight as a plumb line.
Now that's inventive.
And when I'd hit a patch of    mineralized clay, I'd just grind it    up in my teeth to enrich the soil.       Baltrim, let's taste a bit of your    wonderful wine here.
What I'm telling you, Major, is that    I tamed this place.  Me.
I believe you.
You look like a bit of a fighter    yourself.
On Bajor, we had to be.
To get rid of the Cardassians.       Mindless butchers.
We paid them back.
I bet you did... They probably never    knew what hit them.  I'm sorry I    missed the fun.
Fun?
Like spearing kandippers in a bottle.
Wait a minute; are you serious?  You    know what the Cardassians were like;    the weapons they had.  We didn't    stand a chance against them.
Well then, how did you beat them?
We beat them because...    (beat, she realizes     where he's taken her)   ... We hung on like fanatics.
Hung on like fanatics.       I'll have to remember that.
Listen to me, Mullibok...
scene: 31   EXT. OUTSIDE COTTAGE - NIGHT - FAVORING KILN AREA

quote: You know, one of these days I've got    to finish this kiln... So I can temper    my baking pots... put colorful tops    on them.  That'd be nice, wouldn't    it?
scene: 31   EXT. OUTSIDE COTTAGE - NIGHT - FAVORING KILN AREA

quote: Look... I appreciate that you're    trying to hang on here... and I    sympathize... but you can't stay.     The minute they start tapping the    crust, it will release sulfer and    carbon compounds that will make the    air unbreathable.
scene: 31   EXT. OUTSIDE COTTAGE - NIGHT - FAVORING KILN AREA

quote: The Cardassians probably told you    that you didn't stand a chance,    either.  Did you surrender?
scene: 31   EXT. OUTSIDE COTTAGE - NIGHT - FAVORING KILN AREA

quote: No.
scene: 31   EXT. OUTSIDE COTTAGE - NIGHT - FAVORING KILN AREA

quote: Then why would you expect me to act    any different than you?       You tell them they can start cracking    this moon apart anytime they're ready.     I'll be here.
scene: 31   EXT. OUTSIDE COTTAGE - NIGHT - FAVORING KILN AREA

quote: I'll tell them.
scene: 31   EXT. OUTSIDE COTTAGE - NIGHT - FAVORING KILN AREA

quote: So that's a stem bolt.
A self-sealing stem bolt.  There's a    difference.
You're sure about that... ?
What's important is that it's top    grade merchandise.  You can't find a    better stem bolt in this sector.
And we have a hundred gross of them!
That's a lot of stem bolts.
Excuse me, gentlemen...
Anyone know what this cargo is doing    here?
Uh... it belongs to my Uncle Quark;    they're... stem bolts.
Well, do me a favor and tell your    uncle we're getting a bit weary of    him short-circuiting import    procedures.
I'll certainly do that, Sir...       It's just that my Uncle Quark really    needed some stem bolts...
You mean self-sealing stem bolts.
That's right!  That's it!  Self-   sealing stem bolts.
He sure needs a lot of them.
This is top grade merchandise.  You    can't find a better stem bolt in    this sector.
I don't doubt it.  What's he need    them for?
Oh... the usual.
The usual?
Well, you know...       ... Why does anybody use self-sealing    stem bolts...
I wouldn't know; I've never used
Never?
I've never even seen one.
Then how did you know they're self-   sealing?
I read it here on the manifest padd.
I would've bet anything he'd know    what they were.
I told you we should've asked that    freighter captain.
Wait... I know who can tell us what    self-sealing stem bolts are!  The    Bajoran who ordered them in the first    place.  His name's gotta be on the    shipping codes.
Sirco Ch'Ano... It has his address    and everything.  You think he'll be    mad that we have his stem bolts?
He couldn't afford 'em, remember.     But we'll offer to sell them to him    at a discount.
I'm glad you finally made it back; I    was getting worried.
Is he alone?
I think Minister Toran's in there    with him.
Even better.
I don't understand.  There were forty-   seven other people living on that    moon.  They all left willingly.
How do we know?  All we know is that    they obeyed the order to leave.
And so will these people.
You haven't met Mullibok.
Is there anything you can offer that    might make him more willing to leave?
Not a thing, believe me.
Would a postponement help?
It'd give us time to work something    out with him.
We can't postpone, and if he stays,    he'll be committing suicide.       We'll have to beam him off the    surface.
If we take him like that, we'll be    killing him.

I refuse to allow three stubborn    holdouts to jeopardize a project    that'll benefit so many of our people.       I'm sorry, Major; if there were    anything else we could do, we'd have    done it.
But there is another way.  We can    tap the core using phased energy    retrieval.

I thought we had agreed that phased    energy retrieval would take too long.     It would mean waiting a full year    before we could extract any meaningful    amount of energy.  I wish we had the    time to be more delicate, but we    don't.
So instead, we'll act like    Cardassians...
Easy, Major.

I resent that.  It's obvious to me    that you've developed a feeling for    this man.  Fine; I can accept that.     But if you're not comfortable with    completing this assignment, I'll    find someone who is.
(resigned to the     inevitable)   That won't be necessary.
Kira to Odo.
Odo here...
I'm going back to Jeraddo.  I need    two security officers to meet me at    Runabout Pad Three immediately.
They'll be there.
Is there something I should know?
I am not a Cardassian!
I knew that.
I mean... What's the point!  If we're    going to act like Cardassians, why    did we bother to get rid of them in    the first place!
Not a good meeting, huh?
All right, so it is my job, and I'll    do my job, but it's wrong!
Mullibok?
Mullibok!
What about the other two?

They have a cottage about...       ... thirty-five, forty meters through    there.  Now remember; these people    were victims of the Cardassians.     They don't speak; they're very    frightened of uniforms.  Understood?
Understood, Major.
If they're out working in the fields,    just... start gathering their    supplies... clothing, I guess...
Without permission?
We're not going to get permission.     Just be careful with everything.
You plan on using that... ?
Protocol.       If you like, I'll help you pack your    things.
You sent those two uniforms after    Baltrim and Keena.
That's right;  I'm doing what has to    be done.
Me, too.
Don't make us take you by force...    Please!

I promise you it won't be that bad.     You can plant whatever you want on    Bajor; keep to yourself if you want    to; that's fine.  Take some seeds    with you for those terrible roots of    yours I had to eat.  Just listen to    reason!
Just listen to yourself, Major.     Tell me what you hear.
What do you mean?
I mean you sound like a two-headed    Malgorian I knew as a boy.
Did you every try talking with a two-   headed Malgorian?
This is no time for one of your    stories...
You see, the thing about a two-headed    Malgorian is, it can never make up    its mind about what it really wants.     Which can be very confusing, believe    me.
Eventually, you're going to have to    stop talking, and deal with this.

Now you see, that was the trouble    with my Malgorian friend.  He always    had problems, and he could never    decide how to solve them.  So he    would come looking for me to deal    with his problems for him.
Mullibok, please...
And you know what I finally told    that Malgorian?  "Fellows, deal with    it yourselves."
Fine.  I'll pack your things myself.
Major!
They're crazy!  The man just stuck    me with a farm tool, and she came at    me from behind!
Let her go!
Stay back!
No!
You!  Beam up to the Runabout and    call the station!  Get Doctor Bashir!     Move!
I'm sorry, I still can't see you.     What'd you say your name was... ?     I'm getting some kind of subspace    interference.
My name's...
We're, uh...       ... the Nog and, uh... The "Noh-Jay    Consortium."  And we have a hundred    gross of self-sealing stem bolts.     We were wondering...
You have my stem bolts?  What would    you want for them?
We'll let you have them for five    bars of gold-pressed latinum.
Five bars!
Four bars.
I don't think I...
Three bars.
If I had any latinum, I'd already    have the bolts.  Would you consider    an exchange?
I'd consider one bar of latinum...
He doesn't have any latinum.  Let's    trade for something.
I don't want "something."  I want    latinum.
I can't hear you... Can I interest    you in a piece of land?
Land is good.
For what?  It's nothing but dirt.
How much land?
I can let you have seven tessipates.
"Seven" sounds good.
First yamok sauce... then stem    bolts... now tessipates... and still    no profit.
But we're getting closer... I can    feel it.
You can?
I think so.
Do we have a deal?
We'll have to see proof that you own    the land.
Naturally.  You'll get a transmission    on that by twelve hundred hours.
You've bought yourself some stem    bolts.
Land!
Dirt.
Just rest easy.  You took a phaser    blast which punctured your peritoneum.     It's serious, and if you try moving    around, you're going to make it worse.
Another uniform.
Doctor Julian Bashir, Starfleet.     Major Kira sent for me.
She did, uh?...       ... You're backwards, Nerys... I told    you...
With me unconscious, she could've    just had us swept off of here with    no trouble at all.       My friends... Baltrim and Keena...
They've been evacuated to Bajor.     I'll be taking you back to our    station, so I can...
No.  I stay here.
He refuses to leave.
Really.
He's got to be cared for.  I'm going    to take him without his permission.
No you're not.
He needs close attention.  There's    no medical facility here.
I'll be here.
Leave me instructions and whatever    medication you think he'll need.
She didn't offer a word of    explanation, Sir.  She simply removed    her uniform tunic and started...    building.

Well Doctor, right now she stands a    pretty good chance of being out of    uniform permanently.       I'm going to tell Minister Toran    that she's remained temporarily on    Jeraddo at your request.
But sir, that... isn't true.
Make it true, Doctor.  Now, please.
Commander, I'd advise that Major    Kira remain on Jeraddo for    humanitarian reasons, uh...       ... How long?
The next day or two.
For the next day or two, sir.
Thank you, Doctor; I'll consider    that request.  Dismissed.
What's that?
It's for deep bruises.  Don't ask my    why it works, I'm not the doctor.
What're they going to do to you for    staying here?
Probably the same thing they'll do    to you.  I don't really know.
What're you so angry about?
I don't really know...
... When I was very small... I remember    there was a tree just outside my    window.  It was the ugliest, gnarled    and battered old tree I've ever seen.     Even the birds stayed away from it.
But you loved it.

I hated it.    (turns; faces him     squarely)   Because it'd grown so huge that its    branches blotted out the sun for    kellipates.  And its roots were    buried so deep in the soil that    nothing else could grow there.  It    was a big, selfish, annoying...
...Nasty...
Nasty old tree.
Sounds to me like it had character...
A lot.
And what happened to it?  Did you    cut it down?
I don't know yet.
Sisko to Kira...
(frowning surprise;     taps combadge)   Commander?
I'm preparing to beam down.
I don't think that's a good idea.
Major... Either I'm coming down, or    you're coming up.
Doesn't have much faith in you, does    he?
Now just hold on, Nerys.  This is    still my home.
What do you want?
I'd like to see Major Kira.
She doesn't want to see you, and    neither do I.
Wait a minute... don't speak for me.
You know, you're causing a lot of    trouble.
I can't tell you how delighted I am    to hear it.       How many of your Federation uniforms    do you plan to send after me?     Forty... ?  Fifty?
I don't think it'll come to that.
Depends how badly you want to get    rid of me.
Mister Mullibok, I'm here because    I'm concerned about my first officer.
What about her?
By staying here, she's jeopardizing    her career.
You'd better get back into bed.
Stop telling me what to do!
Major, can I see you outside for a    minute?
Go on, talk all you want; tell him    your story about the tree.
Be quiet.
You see, there was this big, ugly    tree...
Go on...
(sees he's not getting     a rise)   Never mind.
I can see why you like him.
What can I do for you, Commander?
You and I have a materiel subsistence    report to finish by the end of the    week.
I'm not sure I'll be able to help    you with that.
It's part of the liaison officer's    job.
I know.
I don't like the prospect of having    to break in a new one...
You have a job to do here, Major,    and you're not doing it.
It's not as simple as that.

I'm not saying it's simple; I'm saying    it can't wait.       Look, I understand you're used to    sympathizing with the underdog.     You've spent your life fighting to    overcome impossible odds... just    like he's doing.  But you have to    realize something, Major...       ... You're on the other side now.
Pretty uncomfortable, isn't it?
It's awful.

When I first met you, Major, I thought    you were hostile and arrogant.  But    I was wrong.  Bajor needs you, and I    need you.       I like you... I don't want you to be    hurt.       So as a friend, I came here to remind    you... His fate is already decided...    Yours isn't.
Thank you.
There'll be a Runabout standing by.       One to beam up.
Mullibok?
...No... Let go... You're hurting    her... Lussilla!  No!...
Easy... Easy...
(angrily, not referring     to Kira)   I told you!  Get your hands off me!
... that's right... just rest... it's    going to be fine...
Oh... it's you.
You were having a bad dream.
Not just a bad dream... bad memories.       I didn't say anything, did I?
No.       Are you thirsty?
No.
Hungry?
Leave me alone.
Go back to sleep.
Where are you going?
I'd like to get some sleep, too.
Fine.  But bring the chair over here.
Well, are you my nurse, or not?
Is this better?
Are you going to talk all night, or    let me sleep?
Nog, I'm waiting.
I'm thinking.
About what?
Latinum.  And how we don't have any.     All we have is dirt.
How many times do I have to tell    you... It's not dirt; it's land.
And what're we supposed to do with    this land?
Sell it, I guess.
To who?
Why do I have to think of everything.
We should've kept the stem bolts.
Land is better than bolts.
How do you know?
You can build things on land.
You can't build anything without    bolts.
Just throw down a card.
And you say they're based here on    the station?
That's correct.
... The Noh-Jay Consortium... No,    never heard of it.  Why do you ask?
I was contacted by a government    official this morning.  They want to    build a reclamation facility on a    strip of land owned by four different    people.
... Three of them have agreed to sell,    but the government doesn't know how    to contact the fourth... this Noh-   Jay Consortium...
You mean the government can't build    without that one piece of land?
Apparently not.
What a wonderful opportunity for    profit...
I told you land was better than bolts.
... And you think that I'm part of    this consortium?
I think very little goes on here    without your knowledge.
True.  This time, however...       ... someone failed to include me.
Are you telling me you're not    involved?
Not yet.  But that will be remedied;    and you can tell the Bajorans I'll    be opening negotiations with them    shortly.
Let's see... Who on this station is    clever enough...
Uncle Quark?
Not now.
But... Uncle Quark...
Go sweep the floor!
This is important.
Well?  Make it fast.
I have a... business opportunity    that might interest you... It'll    only cost you five bars of gold-pressed    latinum.
Any pain?
A little sore.  I was starting to    think you'd sleep all day.
That's because I was up all night    taking care of you.
I don't recall asking you to.
Look, I can handle this.  Go in and    get something to eat.
There isn't time.
Why?  You finally leaving?
Last one.
I never thought I'd finish it.
It's finished.
Nothing left to do but fire it up.
What's all this?
You finished your work; I have to    finish mine.
But you don't want to.
No... I don't.       Look.  I could use a friend on Bajor.     I'd like it to be you.
Major, as long as that cottage    stands... I stay right here.
What the hell are you doing!
Saving your life.
So you chose your uniform over me    after all.
That's not true.  The time I've spent    with you here has meant a lot to me.     But it's over.  It's time we got on    with our lives.  Mine... and yours.
You say you're my friend.  Prove it.       Use that thing on me.
I can't...
If I leave this place... I die.
No you won't.  I won't let you.
Energize.
